headline: Small Stocks Lead Markets Higher
summary: Smaller firms outperformed recent market leaders like tech and communications stocks.  Stocks’ summer climb showed signs of slowing last week, until a speech from Federal Reserve Chair  Jerome Powell  Friday recharged markets and sent the Dow industrials to a fresh record by opening the door to lower interest rates.  This week, a positive earnings season and hopes of a forthcoming rate cut have lifted the share prices of smaller companies and left some investors turning their attention to recently unloved parts of the market.

raw.headline: Small Stocks Lead Markets Higher

Stocks’ summer climb showed signs of slowing last week, until a speech from Federal Reserve Chair  Jerome Powell  Friday recharged markets and sent the Dow industrials to a fresh record by opening the door to lower interest rates.  This week, a positive earnings season and hopes of a forthcoming rate cut have lifted the share prices of smaller companies and left some investors turning their attention to recently unloved parts of the market.

headline: US could seek piece of defense companies, Commerce chief says
summary: STORY: The Trump administration is considering taking stakes in defense companies and other firms it does business with, including Lockheed Martin and Boeing.That's according to U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick, who told CNBC on Tuesday he believes talks are needed around how the government finances its munitions acquisitions, as he defended President Donald Trump's push for a greater government role in American business.Lutnick said Pentagon officials are considering taking pieces of government contractors, including AI powerhouse Palantir Technologies.Boeing declined to comment, and representatives from Lockheed and Palantir did not immediately respond to a request for comment.Lutnick's comments came a day after President Trump said he wants to make more government investments in American companies...having already announced a near-10% stake in Intel and revenue-sharing deals with fellow chipmakers Nvidia and AMD.But critics warn this change could potentially impede these companies' independence, said Liz Miller, president of Summit Place Financial Advisors."If President Trump starts this, and promises no interaction, that doesn't tell us at all what future presidents might do."Shares of Lockheed Martin, Boeing and Palantir Technologies were all higher in Tuesday morning trading.

raw.headline: US could seek piece of defense companies, Commerce chief says

headline: Boeing (BA) Secures Historic Order from Korean Air to Modernize Fleet
summary: Boeing (BA) recently received a major boost when Korean Air announced its intent to purchase 103 of its aircraft, marking the airline's largest-ever order. This substantial agreement, expected to support 135,000 U.S. jobs, could have significantly influenced Boeing's share price, which moved 13% over the last quarter. Meanwhile, Boeing's Q2 earnings showing an increase in revenue to $22.7 billion could also have reinforced this market confidence. While the broader stock market was buoyant,...

headline: US FAA to conduct scenario-based planning with Boeing before it may lift 737 MAX production cap
summary: PHILADELPHIA (Reuters) -The head of the Federal Aviation Administration said on Tuesday the agency intends to conduct scenario-based planning, known as tabletop exercises, with Boeing before it will consider lifting the 38-plane-per-month cap on 737 MAX production.  The exercises will review potential issues Boeing may face if it boosts production and aim to ensure the planemaker maintains progress on quality, officials said.  "They still haven't asked us to increase the rate, and we haven't agreed to do anything," FAA Administrator Bryan Bedford told Reuters on the sidelines of an event at the Philadelphia airport on Tuesday.

"They still haven't asked us to increase the rate, and we haven't agreed to do anything," FAA Administrator Bryan Bedford told Reuters on the sidelines of an event at the Philadelphia airport on Tuesday.

headline: BAE Systems delivers 1,000th THAAD seeker for ballistic missile defense program
summary: BAE Systems (LON: BA) recently delivered its 1,000th infrared seeker to Lockheed Martin for integration on the Terminal High Altitude Area Defense (THAAD) interceptor missile, achieving a major production milestone. The THAAD seeker provides key sensing and guidance capabilities that help protect the U.S. and its global allies from ballistic missiles.

headline: Ginkgo Residential Announces Acquisition of 647-Unit, Five-Property Portfolio in Charleston MSA
summary: CHARLOTTE, N.C., August 26, 2025--Ginkgo Residential today announced that it has acquired a five-property multifamily portfolio totaling 647 units across the Charleston, South Carolina metropolitan area. The off-market opportunity marks a continuation of Ginkgo’s strategic focus on high-growth, high-barrier-to-entry Southeastern markets and represents the company’s second acquisition in 2025.

summary: MOSCOW (Reuters) -Russia hopes that a U.S.-Russian joint venture involving Boeing (BA) in the Sverdlovsk region can resume its operations, Russian First Deputy Prime Minister Denis Manturov told the TASS state news agency in an interview.

raw.headline: Trump-Lee talks deliver multibillion dollar investment deals with South Korean heavyweights

headline: Korean Air places record Boeing order during Trump-Lee summit
summary: STORY: Korean Air announced a huge $50 billion order for 103 Boeing planes as well as GE Aerospace engines and servicing on Monday.The announcement came alongside South Korean President Lee Jae Myung’s visit to Washington this week.:: FileThis is the airline’s biggest order for planes to date, and includes Boeing 787s, 777s, and 737s, all valued at about $36.5 billion.Korean Air also announced a separate $13.7 billion GE deal, for engine purchases and maintenance.Several countries in trade talks with the Trump administration have announced or plan major Boeing orders.Korean Air CEO Cho Won-tae told Reuters the historic order will let his airline expand routes to the U.S., Latin America, and South America.:: FileHe said the company had faith in Boeing despite its prior troubles, and that about half of the 103 jets are 737 MAX 10s and roughly 80% will replace existing aircraft.Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick told Reuters the major Boeing and GE deal would boost U.S. aerospace exports.Boeing said the order will support Korean Air’s integration with Asiana Airlines, acquired last year.

raw.headline: Korean Air places record Boeing order during Trump-Lee summit
raw.summary: STORY: Korean Air announced a huge $50 billion order for 103 Boeing planes as well as GE Aerospace engines and servicing on Monday.The announcement came alongside South Korean President Lee Jae Myung’s visit to Washington this week.:: FileThis is the airline’s biggest order for planes to date, and includes Boeing 787s, 777s, and 737s, all valued at about $36.5 billion.Korean Air also announced a separate $13.7 billion GE deal, for engine purchases and maintenance.Several countries in trade talks with the Trump administration have announced or plan major Boeing orders.Korean Air CEO Cho Won-tae told Reuters the historic order will let his airline expand routes to the U.S., Latin America, and South America.:: FileHe said the company had faith in Boeing despite its prior troubles, and that about half of the 103 jets are 737 MAX 10s and roughly 80% will replace existing aircraft.Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick told Reuters the major Boeing and GE deal would boost U.S. aerospace exports.Boeing said the order will support Korean Air’s integration with Asiana Airlines, acquired last year.

headline: Wall Street holds steady just below recent records
summary: Stocks are holding near breakeven in morning trading on Wall Street Tuesday as indexes hover just below their recent all-time highs.  The Nasdaq composite was also mostly unchanged.  Boeing rose 1.6% after Korean Air announced a $50 billion deal with the company that includes buying more than 100 aircraft.

headline: Trump Says South Korea’s Lee Will Stick to Trade, Spending Deal
summary: Trump and Lee on Monday expressed optimism for close cooperation on North Korea, collective security and shipbuilding, yet the deal setting a 15% tariff on South Korean goods will remain unchanged, according to the US president.  The summit was followed by news that Korean Air Lines Co. plans to order more than 100 Boeing Co. jets as South Korean companies followed up with private sector investment on top of $350 billion of government-linked funding for the US set out in the deal.
